channel.title: CSRSS.EXE ...help!
channel.description:
My computer has been running slow for some time now and the cpu usage near at or near 100 all the time. So I went to take a look and there is always these 2 csrss things running. I did a virus scan the other day and it found 2 csrss files but could not delete them. I did a search on csrss today and read many responces about them. There should NOT be any csrss files anywhere but C:WINDOWSsystem32.
I have found 4 others.. I can send anyone a picture to see if you get on msn, aim, or yahoo.. Just add me: msn: littlexhabit@hotmail.com aim: angelcutie102938 yahoo: angelcutie102938
Please help me remove them... I can't remove them because it is "a critical system process."[br][size=1]Posted at: July 14, 2006, 01:56:13 PM[/size][hr]Now all I have left to get rid of is two of them(the other 2 deleted easily):
Name In Folder Size Type csrss C:WINDOWSdata 73 KB Application <--- Cannot be deleted by antivirus, or shut down in task manager.. csrss C:WINDOWSmsapps 73 KB Application <--- Same as above
Here's a link to pic: http://rapidshare.de/files/25852175/csrsspic.bmp.html

IT GOT RID OF THEM!!! :D :D :D :D [/quote] Nice. I hate this friggen spyware. Watch out for spyware scanner which actually instals spyware on to your computer and then has the nerve of saying it will delete the 30 or 40 spyware/adware it installed for you if you pay them. :rolleyes:
Rofl.. It gives spyware then makes you pay to uninstall it? Lol.. =\ Neways, thanks again for helping Zach. :D And I was gonna say something to that guy but I am just too nice.. :)

item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

nade:

Dumbass, could have done it in 15 seconds without safemode

Please shut up, it is normal for people who don’t know much about computers to be afraid of messing with the registry, and your method doesn’t always work. Some of the more severe viruses wont show up in a startup reg.

P.S.
Angel1, good to see you got them off.

item.title: CSRSS.EXE ...help!
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

[quote=“Ange1, post:17, topic:4943”]The only thing I know about HKEY is that if I delete something it can screw up my computer… So I’d rather do it another way. If there is no other way I will take a risk and try that… And I’m not very good with computers, so no, I haven’t booted into safe mode. Even if I did I would not know what to do.

And…

  1. I don’t have paypal.
  2. I don’t play runescape.[/quote]
    Going into safe mode is easy, just turn off your computer. When it is off, press to power button (to turn it on) and immediately start tapping F8. You should then come to a menu, and choose Safe Mode. If it askes you if you want to stay in safe mode or press no to go into System Restore, click Yes. Then just go delete the two files. This may or may not work, but at leaste try it.

Edit: If it will not let you delete it, sometimes it will let you move it. Just move it anywhere on your computer, and it wont be able to boot.

P.S.
Nade, if you cannot help without being a jerk about it, then please go sit in a small hole and die.

Read full topic

item.title: CSRSS.EXE ...help!
item.dc:creator: @nade nade
item.description:
@nade wrote:

I am not exactly sure what you need, using tools such as hi-jack this is noob don’t do it

Delete them from registry start up
You probably don’t know where that is so:

Start Run -> “regedit”

Or new batch file and put “regedit” in the source and run

Goto
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE/Software/Microsoft/Windows/CurrentVersion/Run
HKEY_CURRENT_USER/Software/Microsoft/Windows/CurrentVersion/Run

And delete your key “CSRSS.exe”
(There are other startup locations, try these first)

Restart your computer

Find them and delete the files, the files are probably hidden from noobies
You need to enable the showing of hidden files (I have windows vista so this could be off) Goto tools->folder options

If you delete the wrong shit your computer will die

The one in system32 IS GOOD. If the file is anywhere else it is BAD. I can't get rid of it..
Depends what version of windows you have

Read full topic

item.title: CSRSS.EXE ...help!
item.dc:creator: @Ange1 Ange1
item.description:

The one in system32 IS GOOD. If the file is anywhere else it is BAD. I can’t get rid of it…

item.title: CSRSS.EXE ...help!
item.dc:creator: @Ange1 Ange1
item.description:
@Ange1 wrote:

[quote=“Cheesehunk, post:4, topic:4943”]Restart your computer…

I think thats the process that slows down your computer if you have had it on forever, I forget, but the same thing happened to me, and my computer was really slow. I restarted, and it was fine![/quote]
Even I know that is totally off = The real csrss.exe is supposed to be on all the time to open and close handles and stuff like that(wooh for reading ;)).

[quote=“Ron, post:5, topic:4943”]Download Spybot. Update it. Immunize it. Run the scan. Do the same with Ad-Aware and Spyware Doctor. One of those 3 will find it. 90% chance that spybot will find it after you update it.

Try going on task manager and ending each instance of csrss.exe. One of them is legit (Cause me and everyone else with microsoft computers has it).

If that doesn’t work, then at least try to find the name of the spyware on your computer.[/quote]
Two programs I used DO detect it but can not delete it… When I goto task manager and try to close them it says that it is a “critical system process. Task Manager cannot end this process.”
I need like a force uninstaller or something. That one moveonboot thing did not work… I downloaded it and it didn’t open.
[br][size=1]Posted at: July 14, 2006, 06:23:44 PM[/size][hr]Uhhhh… I went to helptogo.com but couldn’t figure out where to post it… So I will post it here…

item.title: CSRSS.EXE ...help!
item.dc:creator: @wixter wixter
item.description:
@wixter wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:5, topic:4943”]Download Spybot. Update it. Immunize it. Run the scan. Do the same with Ad-Aware and Spyware Doctor. One of those 3 will find it. 90% chance that spybot will find it after you update it.

Try going on task manager and ending each instance of csrss.exe. One of them is legit (Cause me and everyone else with microsoft computers has it).

If that doesn’t work, then at least try to find the name of the spyware on your computer.[/quote]
after that, download a program called hijackthis from here
http://www.merijn.org/downloads.html
after you’ve downloaded it, click run and save log file,wait until its finished and then post it at
www.helptogo.com and wait for a reply,what this basically does is list all the programs running on your system and the friendly people at help2go.com will tell you what to remove, and what to keep ;)

Read full topic

item.title: CSRSS.EXE ...help!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Download Spybot. Update it. Immunize it. Run the scan. Do the same with Ad-Aware and Spyware Doctor. One of those 3 will find it. 90% chance that spybot will find it after you update it.

Try going on task manager and ending each instance of csrss.exe. One of them is legit (Cause me and everyone else with microsoft computers has it).

If that doesn’t work, then at least try to find the name of the spyware on your computer.

Read full topic
